inn1.comm: useless start from Anderson, winging this miles down the leg side and Tharanga flicks this down to a vacant fine leg
better from Anderson this time, on middle-and-off - cutting back into the left-hander, too - and it's calmly pushed out to short midwicket
another cracker from Anderson, this one miles outside the off stump and swinging even wider
left alone outside off. Tighter line
two in a row from Anderson as this one swings back into the left-hander who clamps down on it
left alone outside off
clumped on the front foot to mid-off and there ends a fairly uninspiring first over
good start. On off stump, it's firmly blocked out on the front foot
full and straight - excellent probing line which is cautiously defended, head right over the ball
straighter still this time and Jayasuriya is tempted to push this to leg but, instead, just clamps down on it and pushes it rather dismissively away to the leg side
another inch straighter still from Sidebottom and the left hander nudges this with greater force to the leg side, but without great purpose
a cracker, this - that's the line. In the channel outside his off stump but it's very well left by Jayasuriya who comes forward to shoulder arms
spearing into his off stump, it's defended solidly
massively wide. Anderson's left his line and length in the dressing room I think. Vastly wide of the off stump, the left hander goes for a massive swipe and misses it completely
still too wide, but it's left alone this time
that's much better: straight, full and firmly blocked out
and this time Anderson syncs both his line and length to produce his best ball of the day so far, jumping up on the left hander who plays it quite awkwardly out to cover
a touch fuller, it's pushed out to cover
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler
very good ball indeed, lovely bowling so far from Sidebottom. Excellent pace swinging into the left hander before it cuts away at the last moment. Competently played nevertheless as he shoulders arms
close! More seam movement for Sidebottom as this cuts away from Jayasuriya's fishing, swishing drive outside off
tighter line this time attacking Jayasuriya's off stump. He comes solidly forward, though, barn-dooring this back to the bowler
late cut down to third man, the first stray from Sidebottom which is dispatched...though without great power
an away-swinger outside off which he leaves alone in the style of Jack Russell
gone! Reward for Sidebottom's excellent control this morning as he finds another away-swinger which leaves Tharanga at the very last moment, handing first slip a comfortable catch at waist height
good start from Anderson, attacking his off stump and it's solidly smothered by the batsman
pretty good bouncer that, keeping Jayasuriya on the back foot and he isn't tempted to hook...instead ducking beneath it. Anderson glares without conviction
short of a length, it's pushed out to cover off the back foot
on his legs, Jayasuriya tries to flick this over midwicket but it's too full and the ball wobbles off his pads meekly for a single
just short of a length, defended on the back foot
defended on the back foot to end a decent, tight over
well bowled. A tight line and nagging length, Sangakkara clamps down on it on the front foot
a tough straighter but not straight enough for the left hander to work to leg. It's blocked out on the front foot
firmly defended once again on the back foot. No swing this time for Sidebottom
close...close. This really is an impressive spell from Sidebottom. Just short of a length the left hander was so nearly tempted into driving, but left it alone at the last moment
too straight and he works it to mid-on, but there's too much power in the stroke and they can't steal a single
guided out to cover off the back foot
a touch of width and he capitalises on it, back-cutting it past the lone slip and down to a squareish third man whose dive parries the ball over the rope. A shackles-breaking boundary there
on his legs but just threatening to cut away from the left hander who tentatively punches it back to Anderson
the first stroke of real flourish from Jayasuriya today who whips this from middle through midwicket. No great power in the stroke but effectively smudged through the gap
very full this time, Jayasuriya tries to punch this down the ground but is again bereft of timing
wild! Madness from Jayasuriya who eyes up a ball slanting across him, tries to swing it over midwicket but gets a thick inside edge
flicked off his legs but fine-leg is short and lurking

got him! A fine piece of bowling - the slower ball which Jayasuriya misread and attempted to chip over mid-off. Pietersen nearly made a complete cabbage of it, but took it face height at the second attempt
firmly blocked out on the back foot
very good line! In Sangakkara's corridor who watchfully leaves it alone, some two or three inches from his off stump
commentator's curse. A bit of a stray down the leg side this time but the left hander can't capitalise, nurdling it to a short midwicket
ever so slightly shorter, allowing Sangakkara onto the back foot but the line is too good. It's punched to cover
fuller, spearing into his off stump and it's nudged to leg for a single
on middle stump it's firmly defended
Sangakarra shuffles across his stumps before shouldering arms
neat stroke. Sangakkara's first fluently struck drive, guiding this out to cover
bit of a stray on leg stump which is nudged to leg for a single
ooh, close. Slapped with part disdain, part carelessness on the back foot which falls short of Collingwood at backward point. Neatly picked up on the half volley as you might expect
and he plays and misses! Well bowled Jimmy A, shaping this away from the right handed Jayawardene who plays a nothing stroke outside off
squared up on the front foot, he splurges this out to point
another cracking ball on off stump, threatening to cut away. It's blocked out
Sangakarra shuffles across to defend
ignored outside off
industriously blocked out on the back foot. Very determinedly forced off the back foot: there was plenty of guts and conviction in that stroke
too straight but Sangakarra can't capitalise, nudging it to leg
excellent line again, it's defended
outside off stump, steered off the back-foot into the covers

another one bites the dust! Banged in short, Jayawardene slashed hard outside off stump, but he got a fraction underneath the ball, and Stuart Broad at third man took a fine and fast catch. Problems mounting for Sri Lanka
angled in from outside off stump, defended cautiously in front of middle
short again, width as well, but Silva is not tempted, unlike his captain
lovely tight line from Anderson, once again angling in from wide of the crease and Silva defends with a straight bat
short and wide, and Silva goes for the slash - Broad is in with a chance for a moment or two, but the ball lands just to his right at third man. Well intercepted in front of the rope all the same
strays onto the pads a fraction, and is picked off for a single through square leg
outside off stump this time, left well alone by Silva
starts outside off stump and seams further away. No stroke offered
pulled down short of a length, and Sidebottom is quickly up for an appeal as Silva misses his defensive stroke. Surely pitched outside leg, and height was an issue too. Other than that, pretty close
drawn forward and this time defends effectively
on the pads this time, and flicked behind square for a single
on the pads, and turned into the leg-side
tighter to the off stump, angling in, defended

massive appeal, but given not out! That was a beautiful delivery, which squared Silva up completely and there was an audible nick as the ball zipped through to the keeper. But the umpire spots that it has flicked the pad
turned into the covers to escape the strike
good delivery, wicket to wicket, defended in front of off stump
yorker length, slower delivery, big appeal again, but not out once again. The end of a probing over
pushed into the covers and some thoughts of a quick single. But soon turned down
poor delivery, speared down the leg-side
the same again. Sidebottom's had a long spell in this heat. Maybe he's flagging a touch
better delivery, back on off stump and angling towards the slips. Defended out to point
width outside off stump, Silva shapes to cut but leaves alone - perhaps angling for another wide. Not given
tighter to off stump and defended with a thrust of bat and pad. Excellent quick single
outside off and defended into the covers
clipped firmly off the pads and away to deep midwicket
a bit of width outside off stump, still no temptation
tighter to the stumps but in the slot for the drive. Sangakkara opts to shoulder arms
defended, but uneasily. The ball bobbles off the bottom of the bat and into the crease
shorter but reasonably straight. Sangakkara hops back into his crease and defends
slapped, up and over Paul Collingwood at short cover. Not timed, but the width was there and so was the intent. The ball plugs in the outfield and the sweeper cleans up
a bit of a mix-up in the calling as Bell swoops at cover, but rectified soon enough. Sangakkara could have been in trouble if the non-striker had been committed though. He's a bit jumpy at the mo
on the spot straightaway, and defended to cover
drawn forward in a crab-like defensive shot. Cover picks up again
drawn forward again, and pushed down to mid-on, who fields with a slide
too much width this time, and Silva climbs into it like a starving man. Straight off the meat and it fizzes past backward point. Sri Lanka's first boundary for 58 balls
short, but too short. Silva ducks early and the ball sails over his shoulder
short again, but a much better line. Silva sways late as the ball whizzes past his nose
slightly fuller length, outside off again, defended cagily off the back foot
starts on middle and angles towards off. Sangakkara times it well off the hip to deep midwicket
clipped down to third man
full and angling towards the slips, Sangakkara shuffles across and clips through midwicket again
outside off stump, and nudged down to third man again
outside off stump and a bit of extra bounce. Silva defends with an uncertain parry of the bat
short and angling in to off stump. Defended off the back foot
good bowling again - full length on off stump and seaming away. Sangakkara tries a back-foot punch but can't time it
down on one knee, and slashed through the covers. Swept up in the deep
on the spot, good line and length, and enough zip to keep the batsman honest
outside off stump, defended into the covers with a long stride
fuller length, zeroing in on the base of middle stump. Defended with a perpendicular bat
no width whatsoever. Defended once again to complete another attritional over for Sri Lanka's struggling batsmen
a huge slice of luck for Sangakkara, who defends limply outside off, finds the inside-edge, and manages to just evade his off stump. Mustard does well, diving to his right to intercept
good work by Bopara at deep square leg restricts this to a single
on a good length again and nudged out to point
that's a lovely shot. Not a whole lot of power, but perfect timing to thread a length delivery through the covers and all the way to the rope. That'll cheer him up
shorter outside off stump, dabbed away to third man
floated up into the blockhole, and Sangakkara obliges by blocking
good line and length outside off stump, with a hint of drift towards the slips. Defended
slightly more width, and Silva steers that fine towards the third man boundary, where it is intercepted just inside the rope
fuller length, up in the blockhole and defended again, slightly uneasily it has to be said. Great accuracy from all of England's seamers
whipped to square leg, and the shy comes in with interest to cut off any thoughts of a single

slower ball, Silva waits and waits, and dabs to third man. He decided he wanted two immediately, and Swann's shy was slightly too loopy to execute the run-out. Silva had to dive all the same, and the umpire checked with the replay to make sure
another dab to third man, only a single this time
floated, loopy, some spin, blocked
more spin, through the prod and off the pad into the off side
outside off, pushed hard to point
he dances down the pitch and hits over the top, mistimed, gets a thick edge and it drops in no man's land between mid-off and long-off to his obvious relief
forward, played and the ball dribbles to Mustard
back and cautiously patted to mid-off
driven into the ground, well stopped diving to his right by Bopara at point
slower ball, straight and defended
flicked to midwicket for a simple single
wide and slow, drifting away from the right hander, driven uppishly and not middled to deep cover
deft little nibble off his legs to deepish square leg
big boomer away from the flashing swish of Silva, Mustard makes a neat take
he plays back - should have gone forward, misread that - and defends
arm ball - went back and was almost undone as he again should have gone onto the front foot
attempted sweep from outside off stump, he misses, Swann appeals but outside the line
well outside off, a ripper takes it further away and Sangakkara mistimes hits poke
he shuffles across and whips a ball from outside off to midwicket
A big lunge forward from Silva to defend
full and straight, blocked
back, he waits and then flicks the ball behind square on the leg
wide and swinging, steered to point
on the spot, defended gently to cover
he snaps and attempts a massive cross-batted slog ... and completely misses
tip-and-run into the off side, Anderson fields and hurls ambitiously at the bowler's end and misses ...
full and swept from outside off high and over square leg on the bounce
swept from two feet outside off stump to long leg, no more than a paddle
tossed up and very wide, Silva forward and blocks with his pad
fuller, driven past extra cover but not quite off the middle
gently turned to leg
cut behind square, Anderson makes a good tumbling stop
slower ball, crisp cover drive to the man in the outback
steered behind square to deep backward point
again just steered, using the pace of the ball to help it down to third man
driven uppishly past short extra cover - the bowler yells "catch" but it wasn't
seams back in, Silva goes back and defends to cover
super slow yorker, Silva equal to it and blocks back to Collingwood
pushed into the off side for a strolled run
flatter, Silva forward and blocks but misses and it thuds into his pad
turned into the midwicket region
turned into the on side but not into space
forward, dead batted
fended into the leg side
loose and wide, cracking drive square and Cook makes a good tumbling save on the boundary edge
big swing into Silva who gets into line and defends with bat and pad rammed together
Silva finds a gap and takes a comfortable run
back, turned past midwicket
Silva waits and then jabs the ball deliberately down to third man
pushed to mid-off, a quick run to Anderson who shies at the bowler's end stumps as misses, a sniff of an overthrow but in the end the fielders do enough to deter it
flicked to midwicket
Sangakkara steps back and thwacks the ball to deep midwicket, Anderson does enough to prevent the second
swept from outside off, deep midwicket scurries round to cut it off, unleashes a wild throw but no way they could risk a third
short, cut through backward point
loopy, pushed between midwicket and mid-on
jabbing defensive lunge, a thick edge to point
full and straight, firmly blocked out on the front foot
nudged to leg
driven with a flourish through the cover
pushed out to cover and they grab themselves a single
short, wide, dispatched for four with a severe cut. Tracer bullets come to mind
pushed past the bowler but Anderson at mid-on made a complete hash of it, allowing them through for two extras
too full, on his legs and flicked through midwicket for a single
very wide but very full, and he tries to clatter it through the covers but instead clumps it back to the bowler
late cut to backward point who wings in a ferocious throw
plays and misses outside off. Touch more bounce in that one
full and bending back into the right hander who defends solidly
back cut to a squareish third man
punched on the front to mid-off
beautifully played. It was in the slot, admittedly, but he swung through the line and picked it up over mid-on for four. Effortlessly played
much better. Nice and full and given due respect by Sangakkara
pushed back to the bowler
very nicely bowled. A good length, and Sangakkara might have been better coming forward there. Pushed back to the bowler
and Collingwood fields off his own bowling to end the over
he comes skipping down the pitch to drive before deciding against it, padding it away. Well flighted outside off
Silva waits patiently for this slower ball and nudges it out to the off side for a cheekily stolen single
too short. Sangakkara capitalises and punches it in front of square
again too short. Silva misses out, crunching it hard to point
nicely flighted on off stump. It's defended
a cracker! Quicker, flatter and it bites off the surface, missing Silva's forward poke. Beautifully bowled
a touch too short, Sangakkara harrumphs it to point
punched down the ground to bring up his fifty. Easy single - in fact, they take two thanks to some winning fielding
punched to mid-off where they should only pick up a single. Anderson attempts to destroy the stumps with the wildest of throws and again England gift Sri Lanka some more overthrows
flicked to midwicket
sweetly timed but without the placement, it finds midwicket. Neatly bowled by Bopara
a legside stray picked off for a single to fine leg
wide. A leg-side stray from Swann to begin with
calmly punched off the back foot out to the leg side
here we go, he's lofted him inside out over cover and it falls short of Shah who dives...and does brilliantly to prevent four, getting his sliding body behind it
defended on the front foot
very well bowled indeed. Full, straight and on off stump, Sangakkara blocks it out
flicked through midwicket with ease, but that's another very tight over from Swann. And I've forgotten it's not the end of the over, yet...
down the leg side for another wide
driven with a flourish out to cover
rubbish. Down the leg side and it bobbles of his pad. No, in fact he gets bat on it and it flies down to fine leg
massive appeal as Bopara raps him on the pad, and that looks absolutely dead. The bearded umpire says no, however. Not sure why
pushed out to cover for a lesser spotted quickly run single
a slightly quicker one from Bopara which is timed out to mid-off
another confident appeal from Bopara who raps Silva on the pads but it's going down leg this time. Rudi is statuesque in his disgust for the appeal
late inswing for Bopara which is blocked out
full, straight and defended
pushed to leg
reverse swept for a zero
a looping delivery outside his off stump. Silva attempts to cut, and misses
smartly flicked away through midwicket for two
oh well played, he just got that past Anderson at a short third man and there's his eight one-day fifty
nice and full, cramping the increasingly knackered Sangakkara for room who pumps it past him for a single
much more like it from Silva, wielding his bat like an axe and scything this over the top. Poorly timed though
cut to point who is lurking like a leopard to save the run
absolutely hammered off the back foot, with no regard (or need) to keep it on the ground. Short, wide and slashed hard over point
guided down to third man
beauty! A quicker one which angles across the left hander who plays and misses. Touch of bounce in that too, and it was smartly taken by Mustard
and his reverse sweep comes off this time. He feathered it past Anderson at short third man who looks like he's about to collapse with exhaustion. Smart cricket from Silva
a village delivery from Swann; short, wide and slashed out to cover
on the left hander's legs who turns it off his toes to fine leg
full, fast and Silva makes use of the pace to guide this out to deep extra cover on the front foot
Swann escapes from this poor leg-side stray which Silva can't make anything of
short, wide, cut
good start by Broad pitching this up on off stump. Silva drops it out to cover and sprints through for a single. Another excellent piece of running
the left hander steps across his stumps to try and whip him over midwicket, but is rapped on the pads
very well bowled. Full, straight and Silva can only guide this to Collingwood at backward point
a wide bouncer and Silva uppercuts this down to third man. Bopara runs six or seven metres around the boundary to take an excellent running catch at a comfortable height
a slower ball which Sangakkara misreads, working it out to cover
guided down to third man for a single
scampering through for the quickest of quick singles to short cover. Good running
slow turn from outside off, but  Lokuarachchi rocks back to defend
nudged into the covers to rotate the strike again
one foot down the track, and a firm swat through midwicket. Picked it on line, and cleared Bell's head at short midwicket by a distance
clever play - the power shot followed by the deft shot
firmly played out to deep square leg, and that's the over
full length, floated into the blockhole, driven out to mid-on
width for the left-hander, who drives through the covers, but without excessive power
short, and Lokuarachchi swivel-pulls to backward square

short again, and pulled straight down the throat of deep square leg! That was a sucker punch - it was nothing more than a leg-stump long-hop, and could have done anywhere. Broad looks suitably sheepish, but that's a big wicket for England
outside off stump, and slashed firmly down to third man
outside off, fuller length, angling back in, and after all that, it's defended into the leg-side for a single. That was a subtle slower ball
clipped into the leg-side, and more good running
wicket-to-wicket, drifting slightly onto the pads, worked square without much venom, but effective nonetheless
nudged out to point and another rapid single
slower ball with a bit of width - a quick single to the covers brings about a misfield, but they sensibly decline the second
swept fine, but not fine enough to beat the fielder

perfect line and length, noticeably quicker as well, and Lokuarachchi was beaten all ends up as he aimed a flick to leg. Well bowled, and the umpire's finger was up with Shakoor Rana-esque speed. That was plumb
oops, that was almost worth a double-wide. Barely reached the cut strip
into position early for a firm drive. A quick single to mid-off
off the mark with a nudge to midwicket. No fireworks yet from Sri Lanka
massive wind-up as Dilshan aimed something expansive over midwicket. But the shot wasn't on and instead he stole a single off an under-edge
clipped to square-leg as Sri Lanka are made to deal in singles
another single, this time into the covers. Tight bowling
a seaming delivery to finish, nipping away from the bat, and finding enough of a controlled edge to pick off one more to third man
outside off stump, no pace to work with, nudged to backward point and that would have been out if the shy had been accurate. Instead it's an overthrow
makes room and has a swipe. Clears the man running back from mid-on, but can't quite reach the rope
angled towards the blockhole from outside the left-hander's off stump. Blocked out to the covers
tight line, bending back into the right-hander. Dilshan takes a step back and steers to point
pre-meditated sweep - that really wasn't on for the shot - but he gets enough bat on it to get a single to midwicket
yorker length, angling in to the legs, a bit of an appeal for lbw, but nothing doing. That's the over
on a good length outside off stump, Dilshan has a monstrous swipe across the line, but once again can't time it. Midwicket fields
short and straight. Good bowling, and sensibly left well alone
outside off, and steered gently to deep cover
short and climbing outside off stump. Pulled into the leg-side
superb blow, nothing but bottom-hand in that, and lifted up and over the man at square leg. Not a bad ball at all, full and straight, but well dispatched
a fraction more width, and clubbed out to the deep. Broad's figures take a bit of a dent, but still a fine spell
outside off stump, and steered down to third man
full length, nearly a yorker, and that's the end of that. Dilshan went to mow a meadow, missed, and was bowled through his legs. Still, a useful little cameo
welcomed to the crease with a short ball - accurate too - and Vaas turns turtle
in the slot, and clubbed back down the track. Mid-on half-stops with a full-stretch dive
width, and worked down to the man lurking on the point boundary
a loose delivery, but ironically, the perfect delivery. A wild full-toss outside off, and Vaas was so shocked he could only pat it to cover
slower ball, outside off, tapped to third man
full-length, bending back into the left-hander, clumped down to mid-on
another single, nudged away behind point

a low inswinging full-toss, and Sidebottom strikes! That was an attempted yorker, overpitched and Vaas was onto it in a flash. But Pietersen at short midwicket had no need to move, and toppled over backwards as the ball thudded into his chest
yorker, well directed, and just squeezes past the stumps and through to the keeper
outside off stump, and Fernando feels for it with minimal footwork. Another good over for England

dropped - but a very good effort all the same. Mubarak went down on the sweep and lofted the ball just out of Sidebottom's outstretched grasp. To add to the indignity, Sidebottom's trousers fall down as he chases the ball to the rope!
too much width to work with
that's a great strike - made room early and brought the bat crashing through the line. The ball whistled over the covers and away to the rope
dropped - short and swung out to the deep. Shah made good ground but was reaching low as he misjudged it a fraction
a good yorker - the ball dribbles a foot from the stump, and Anderson in his followthrough sidefoots that into the stumps. The umpire called for the replay, but that was never in doubt
a slower-ball bouncer, but slightly misdirected
short and swung away off a top-edge to backward point. Not quite timed, but at least Mubarak keeps the strike
good bowling. A well-directed yorker, Mubarak stepped across to use the pace and sweep through fine leg, but he missed it entirely and lost his middle stump
good shot - in the blockhole again, but swished away to third man
slower ball, outside leg stump and follows the batsman as he makes room for a swing. The ploy works too, as midwicket keeps them to a single
a flat-batted smear to long-on, but again, no more than a single
swinging away towards the slips, and steered out to cover. One more to the total
excellent final over. Sidebottom saw the batsman make room. followed him all the way down the leg-side, and limited them to a single.

inn2.comm: left alone and quite right ... it sails wide down the off side
down the leg side for variation, it flicks the pads and Sangakkara drops to his right to stop it

sweetly flicked off his legs square on the leg side, Malinga sprints from long leg and then makes a limp attempt to stop the ball with his feet and ends up sitting in a heap on the boundary ropes with the ball next to him
pushed to mid-on
slower ball, it takes the inside edge of a semi-defensive prod and trundles out to midwicket
firm drive towards extra cover, they think about a single but quickly scotch the idea as the fielders converge
and the same again, pushed straight, a couple of steps down the track and then a shout of "no"
slung across the left hander, could have been called a wide but it wasn't ... on the cusp
not much more width but enough to test the patience of Tyron Wijewardene who calls the wide ... with a frown as well
fuller and straighter, pushed up to mid-off
another one hurled wide down the off side. Yet again that could have been called but it wasn't ... you suspect another one down the same route will be, however
straighter, Cook right into line to defend
defended into the off side
outside off stump, much better line and Cook watches it pass
pushed quite sedately to extra cover
blocked to the left of Vaas who adjusts deftly and fields on the bounce
a couple of strides and a shimmy to leg, a swing and the ball flies to Fernando  third man on the bounce
on Cook's pads - he loves that - and that's asking to be hit ... and it is, through square leg
Cook drifts towards the off and steers the ball to midwicket
fuller and driven to extra cover
good line and length, Mustard plays all down the wrong line and is well beaten
defended with a bit of va-va-voom, he wants a run, Malinga sprawls to his right to stop it and Mustard thinks better of it and retreats
this time he gets the run, tip-and-running into the covers and he's quick off the blocks
wide outside off stump again and surely that has to be a wide ... nope, Tyron Wijewardene is not interested
timed off his legs through midwicket ... total silence from the crowd ... even the band seems to have gone for a bite to eat or perhaps they have finally exhausted the one tune they know
outside off and no shot
a crouching cut to Dilshan at point
dropped ... he rocks back and absolutely hammers the ball to short midwicket .. Jayawardene gets a hand to it but can't hold on ... had it, it would have been a wundercatch ...
slower, picked, a step to meet it and then lathered back from whence it came, high and far
and this time he repeats the previous-but-one stroke, pulling through midwicket, a bit higher and no way was anyone going to stop that
clipped through square leg, all along the ground
Cook plays a very correct defensive shot from the crease
nudged into the leg side
Mustard is surprised by some extra bounce as he shapes to pull, the ball takes a thick top edge and flies over the keeper and races to the boundary right behind him
and smeared through wide midwicket again, he's going for his shots and getting away with it
another big swing to leg, this time he misses and looks very ugly in the process
slower, fuller and straighter, Mustard drives the ball right back to Malinga and the catch is at a perfect height ... no mistake there
good start, Bell back, clips the ball to mid-on and scurries for the single
Bell steps to the off, Vaas follows, and he has to play defensively into the off
again Bell moves slightly to the off and defends to mid-off
punched to mid-off
short and wide, cut hard to cover, he stops it but not cleanly and the ball dribbles a couple of yards but he's done enough
a thick edge, Jayawardene at slip dives quicker than Northern Rock's share price but it's out of his reach ... a great effort
too short, cut but not into space
pushed from just outside off to point
driven back at Malinga who skippingly leaps to take the return high above his head
pushed-drive into the off side
Malinga is now hitting the mark most balls ... Cook has to settle for a block
a bit cross-batted, midwicket fields
very wide, again other umpires may well have called that ... Cooks stares down the pitch with no emotion on his face but his eyes tell the story ...
defended to short extra cover
stands tall and drives past short extra cover but there's a second ring of fielders for that eventuality
Bell pegged down by a combination of Vaas and short extra cover
slower and much straighter than any so far this over, Bell again forced to defend
pushed to cover
upright and textbook defensive shot
threaded through an oh-so-small gap between midwicket and mid-on and all the way to the rope ... sublime
a Keystone Cops moment ... driven into the off, one man dives and deflects the ball past his colleague who is completely wrong-footed behind him
defensive poke to the off
good one-day line and length, outside off, back of a length, Bell has to block
slight seam movement into bell who blocks
worked down to deep square leg
Cook works this off the back foot outside the off stump
defended on the back foot
excellent line on off stump. He defends with caution
just a touch shorter this time and Cook is back and across, watchfully defending
but Cook capitalises on Fernando's first loose ball, punching this through the covers off the back foot for four. Top shot - he really got on top of that
a good comeback, spearing this into his legs and it's defended
short of a length, Bell is back and across and defending
punched off the back foot past point
again a little too short again and Bell works it out to cover
pushed out to cover on the front foot
good length, cracked off the back foot but straight to the fielder again
pushed off the back foot to end the over
wide of Cook's off stump, he back cuts it to point
very full and for a moment Cook appeared to be lining up a booming drive. Instead, he chips is back to Fernando
angled out to point off the back foot. No great pace in that delivery
crisply struck out to cover
timed out to cover once again
neatly nudged off his legs
wide of the off stump, Cook climbs into a punchy drive off the back foot but yet again it screams straight to point
a calm defensive prod off the back foot
quick feet from Cook who shuffles back before guiding this out to the off side
fuller this time but Cook was stuck on the back foot and almost done for length
brilliant stroke. He really timed that beautifully, spanking this through the off side for four
and again that's very well timed indeed by Cook, just leaning on it to pick up two through midwicket
a strangled appeal from Fernando who wraps Bell on the pads but it was going down leg
hammered on the front foot; a wonderful free-flowing thwack past point for four
a grunt from the bowler and a cautious defensive poke by the batsman. Good battle, this
a textbook cover drive which, fortunately for Sri Lanka, finds extra cover
drops this short but the pitch is slowing down considerably and it barely bounces on Bell. He plays it well, swivelling into a short-arm pull

full toss on Cook's legs and, once again, the timing is remarkable. He just leant on that and it shot like a bullet through midwicket, though the dew on the outfield (and a good chase by the fielder) prevented four
flighted on middle stump, Bell pumps it to the bowler's left who dives and makes an athletic stop
close! Well bowled, a classical legbreak which beat Bell's poky forward defence
better from Bell this time, clamping down on this full pitched delivery
nicely bowled - good, full length here - but Bell remains back in his crease like a terrific rabbit waiting to be shot, guiding it out to point
the first loose (and short) ball which Bell thwacks into the covers with a resounding crack
kept just a touch low there and he works it out to the off side
good line, testing Bell on his off stump but he's up to the task and defends with a barn door
swinging into Bell who's rapped on the pads
again swinging into Bell but it's on his legs now and he flicks this neatly through midwicket
good angle. Wide of the crease and spearing into Bell who tries to nudge it to leg
full, straight and chipped out to cover
he really bent his back there, but even with the extra effort he couldn't gain much bounce. Calmly knocked away by Bell
on Cook's off stump, spearing back in and it's firmly smothered
short of a length, terrific shot from Cook - top class. A loosener from the bowler, granted, but he capitalised on it well
nudged to leg
tossed up on middle-and-off, Cook pats it away as though kicking a stray conker out of his path
beaten! What a ball that is. Big turn, Cook came forward but was beaten
nurdled to leg but straight to the fielder
a poor and very wild leg-side stray which flies down the leg side
gone! No, but that was damn close. A good slower ball deceiving Bell who chipped it just in front of the diving extra cover
edged down to third man
too short, Bell tucks him behind square for an easy single
sweetly timed, that shot along the turf like a snooker ball across the baize but there's a sweeper on the boundary
slanted out to point
Bell goes big, or tries to, the ball dropping just short of the long-on boundary like a mis-hit golf shot
nearly beaten in the flight there, chipping this just over cover's head
worked through midwicket
short, pulled through midwicket
beautifully chipped over midwicket for four
soft shot. He attempted to pull it but got a top-edge straight to Malinga at mid-off. An absolute waste of his wicket and he's rightly furious
fast and full, and defended with a dead bat into the covers
fizzes through to the keeper with a bit of an "ooh" from the fielders
Outside off stump, and left alone watchfully
back on the stumps, and prodded away to the off side
full toss outside off stump - if Cook still had his eye in, that would have travelled. Instead he pokes loosely and misses
slower delivery, turned to the leg-side
good length and tempting outside off. Pietersen has an exploratory drive which is intercepted in the covers
big stride and dead bat
nudged into the off side to get off the mark in casual fashion
looped onto a full length outside off stump, turned gently to the leg side for another single
big stride and big intent as well, but cover intercepts
outside off stump - Sri Lanka are feeding Pietersen's drive and his ego - but once again it's well cut off in the covers
short, wide and wasted down the leg-side
steps across to the off side and is into position early for the drive. But it doesn't come off
that's a sweet strike, and it's just what he's been looking for. A full stride, a flowing blade, and that's arrow-straight, back past the bowler
a big grunt of effort at the crease, and Pietersen turns this one into the leg side
banged in short, and nudged off the hip
full length, searching for the yorker. Just outside off stump and defended from the crease
shorter in length, and in the slot for the cut. He waited a long time for that and hit it well, but straight to gully
frantic footwork from KP, but he can't beat the bowler who fields in his followthrough
that's the boundary, and it's a well-timed strike. Malinga at midwicket might have done better to cut it off, but it's valuable runs to England's cause
outside off stump this time, and a jogged single is the upshot
tossed up outside the left-hander's off stump, and it bites off the pitch as well. Whipped wristily into the leg-side
floated onto the pads, Pietersen tries to whip firmly through the leg-side, but can't beat the field
cut and a bit of width as well, and Pietersen cuts through the covers to complete the over and bring up England's hundred
leg-stump line from over the wicket. No width for Pietersen who tries to hustle that through midwicket, but misses
outside off and Pietersen plays with the turn. Just sizing up the new bowler
tucked leg-side for a jogged single
pitches leg-and-middle and is turned gently into the leg-side
finds the gap at midwicket and contemplates a second, but Pietersen is already scratching the crease
driven down the ground to long-on, and that's another over gone. Halfway through, and England are on track
flicked off the hips and another single to the cause
attacking intent from Pietersen - he's down the track to this one and makes to have a mow. But mid-off cleaned up
finds the gap in the covers this time. He's really trying to dominate - which funnily enough, is not what England really need at the moment
down the pitch again and gets away with a slight miscue. He's not happy with this tempo
floated onto a length, six inches outside off, and nurdled behind square
a big ripping legbreak to finish, but it's too short, wide and slow-turning for Pietersen to bother offering a shot
clipped off the pads, and through midwicket
Pietersen's turn to nurdle a single. No big swishing this time, and the result is just the same, but safer
a fraction too short, and Cook has all the time in the world to rock back and work this down to third man
tucked into the leg-side
a full-toss, but Pietersen fails to capitalise.
a flighted tweaker outside off, and Jayasuriya hops with excitement as the ball goes airborne on the leg-side. But no hope of anyone catching it
looped up outside off stump, and Pietersen flashes it through the covers, but straight to the sweeper. A lot of effort, but no more than a single
full and wide outside off stump. Left alone
shorter in length, and Cook climbs into a swivel-pull. Still no great timing. None needed though
clumped firmly into the covers
too much width and that's nicely timed through the covers. A flowing drive, but Fernando has time to run around and field on the rope
a dot ball to finish, and Pietersen's frustration is palpable. It's not needed though. England are cruising so long as he stays in
fielded with a tumble at point
back onto the stumps and worked into the leg-side
another single. No threat in the bowling at the moment
defended. Pietersen bides his time
wicket-to-wicket. Nudged off the legs
a big stride and a nurdle into the leg-side brings up Cook's half-century. Well played that man
full length and aimed at the blockhole, nudged past gully
tucked off the pads again, picked up at leg-gully
worked into the leg-side again. This is ... slow
a hint of an appeal, but from round the wicket, that was never going to hit. A bit of desperation in that appeal
defended. Watchfully. Well, why not
finds the gap behind square and that's some good scampering
outside off, left alone
stroked to point
leg-side line, whipped to deep square leg
pushed to the left of mid-on
down the leg side, Pietersen steps the off, let's it, and it's called a wide
Pietersen across and into line
clipped to deep backward square leg
quick single into the leg side to bring up the fifty stand
loopy, Pietersen forward almost mockingly
pushed to mid-on, Pietersen called for a mad run, Cook responded and was all at sea but the throw was appalling and he got home with ease
turned to the man saving one behind square on the leg
defended to midwicket
steps back and cuts to point
defended by KP
again Pietersen takes on mid-on, and again he is saved by some sloppy fielding. Mubarak was the culprit
easy turn to leg, between the two men and that is risk-free
driven rather inside out to long-off
pulled, although it kept a bit low and so he ended up playing a slightly ungainly-looking shot through midwicket
dropped into the leg side
Cook steps back and cuts between point and cover, it's chased all the way to the rope and just hauled back in time
one big stride and then a straight drive skews uppishly to long-off
a massive stride forward, he plays round it and a long and loud shout gets nowhere
milking gaps, this time behind square on the leg side
Pietersen again takes on mid-on and this time with more comfort ... Mubarak must be feeling picked on
blocked into the leg side
aims for the yorker, a yard too full, turned to midwicket
pushed defensively to mid-off
Pietersen starts to advance, Malinga sees him coming and digs it in, but the pitch is such a pudding that Pietersen still has time to pull to deep midwicket
on leg stump, turned to the man way out ...
short and slower, Pietersen undone by the change of pace, shapes to pull but takes one on the glove instead
Malinga feeding Cook on leg stump ... he'll accept those gifts for as long as they are on offer
driven back to the bowler
cut past backward point, Malinga in the deep slides round to cut it off
too full, driven off his toes to deep midwicket
read the spin, lunged and left
two steps turns it into a full toss which he drives to long-off
dead-bat defensive prod to point
kept low, Pietersen almost appears to have a spasm so jerky is his dropping of the bat, just in time and he gets an edge on the ball
more in control drive but to extra cover
loud and worthwhile shout, Pietersen steps across to work Vaas into the leg side and misses ... but it may have hit him just outside the off-stump line
mid-off is up on the one, Pietersen spots that and drives between him and the bowler .. crisp and clinical
back but a mistimed drive to mid-on
Pietersen steps to the off and this time he does middle it, out into the leg-side outerlands
twiddled into the leg side
taken on the pad
Cook misses an attempted pat into the leg side, a loud appeal for leg-before turned down
again keeping it tight, flicked to square leg
drifts to leg, Cook accepts that and caresses the ball to deep square leg
too short, Pietersen steps back and lays into that, Silva runs a long way round from deep cover and stops the ball on the edge with his foot
down the leg side, well stopped by Sangakkara standing up, but it's a wide
keeps a little low again, Cook hits hard to midwicket
again a little low, Cook cuts to backward point, smartly picked up
punched off the back foot, no real power but neatly placed and two past cover
fuller, driven hard and an excellent diving stop by cover
turned from off stump to midwicket
driven to cover ... and that really is over
one step, two steps, no tickly under there but a big smack down the ground, up and over and six
after the Lord Mayor's Show ... defensive poke into the leg side
driven to long-off
sublime ... caressed effortlessly through the off side, too full and that was a great shot to watch in any form of the game
full on leg stump, Cook check-blocks to midwicket for an easy single
Pietersen goes up and over again, advancing to meet the ball and it goes on the bounce to cow corner / wide midwicket
angled out to point
spearing into his legs, he pushes it out to cover
driven on the front foot, he opens the face of the bat to guide this out to a deep point
a "one-handed woof" as my colleague just said, as Pietersen drove this, well, one handedly to mid-off
powerfully smacked to mid-on
a reasonable bouncer which Pietersen ignores it
on his legs
on his legs, it's flicked through midwicket
a typical Pietersen shot; stepping outside off, he turns it with a flick of the wrists to long-on
shot. Cook steps outside leg and cracks it hard out to deep extra cover
straighter and flatter, pumped to long-on
fired in flat, Cook defends
full and straight, spearing into Pietersen's off stump, he drives it out to cover
down the leg side and Sangakkara can't collect it. Awful delivery, and it escapes to the fine-leg boundary for five tasty wides
half a shout from Fernando as Pietersen walks across his stumps, but it's missing leg
pushed out to cover
bowled him! Cook is furious with himself. Short of a length outside his off stump, Cook tries to cut this but it's too short and he chops it on. He swings his bat in utter disbelief
got him! Two in two for Fernando as Collingwood is trapped dead in front, and up goes the finger
well bowled! A quick one, nice and full but off target and Shah works it to leg quite easily
Pietersen lines up a booming, shmooming drive but can only crack it straight at mid-off
vicious yorker (or a near-yorker) which spears into Pietersen. KP digs it out back to the bowler
hit past the bowler on the back foot and, belatedly, he calls Shah through for a single
fantastic shot! Shah took a Pietersen-esque step down the pitch and absolutely creamed this through extra cover. Class
guided on the full (and on the walk) to point. A very Shah-y stroke
good idea - the slower ball - but Shah reads it and defends it
a tired bouncer, misdirected down the leg side
lovely inventive stroke, picking this from middle-and-off and forcing it through midwicket. The sweeper will collect
better. Full and straight, Shah just comes forward patiently to defend
an ugly cross-batted swipe at a half-volley. Not sure what Shah was trying to do there
a full toss which Shah bunts to deep point
and that could be four of them...no, a flourishing drive is saved by the extra-cover sweeper
hammered back to Fernando who parries the ball onto the non-striker's stumps
Malinga fires down a slower ball which Shah guides to point
sliced over point this time and the ball drops like a shell in the outfield
very well bowled! A slower-ball yorker, right on the money but Shah's up to the task and blocks it out solidly
no slower-ball this time: that was Malinga at pace, reversing it back into Shah who was comprehensively beaten and his stumps flayed
fast, but misdirected. Bopara pats it to leg
solidly defended by Bopara in the end but a cracking ball with which to end the over, swinging into the right hander at the last moment
Pietersen skips down the pitch and bunts it back to the bowler
a full toss, pushed through midwicket
flicked through midwicket
and the scores are level as he flicks this one to midwicket

and there it is! England win the series 3-1 as he just whips this leg-side delivery down to fine-leg. Pietersen runs through and jumps in the air in delight, pumping his fist. He's found form at last and has taken England through to not only an impressive win today, but an excellent series victory
